Summary: To estimate ratios of market values (equity and firm) to book value (equity and firm), with companion variables (ROE and ROC)
Vars: Number of firms in the industry grouping.
Aggregated market capitalization divided by aggregated revenues, across all firms in the group.
Measure of market value of equity, relative to revenues reported.
Aggregate net income divided by aggregated revenues, across companies in group.
Measure of after-tax profitability, from equity investors perspective
Aggregated enterprise value divided by aggregated revenues across all firms in the group. (EV = Market Cap + Debt - Cash)
Measure of market value of firm, relative to revenues reported
Aggregate after-tax operating income divided by aggregated in revenues, across companies in group.
Measure of pre-tax profitability, from operations
table_summary: This table provides a summary of key financial metrics for various industries. It includes the number of firms in each industry, the price-to-sales ratio, net profit margin, enterprise value to sales ratio, and pre-tax operating margin. Each row represents a different industry, offering a snapshot of its financial health and performance.
